Today in Cornwall, North is lighting up with clean 7ft @ 13s W swell and light 10 mph SSE winds. Crantock and Fistral are prime spots, especially during their best tide windows. Tomorrow, conditions drop with 13ft @ 12s W swell and fresh 38 mph WSW winds, making it blown out across the board. By the day after, North settles back to 7ft @ 12s W with 16 mph SW winds, offering workable waves at spots like Crantock and Fistral. Best: today.
